page.title: 05Charing school 1873 to 1985
page.content: Charing C of E School is one hundred and eleven years old. Over these past years Charing School has changed a great deal. Charing School was first opened on the 13th January 1873 by John Grainger Williams, who undertook charge of the schools for a term, until a permanent appointment was made. Charing School used to be a seperate boys and girls school until 1877 when it became a mixed school as it is today. Today there are one hundred and forty seven pupils attending this school in six classrooms with seven teachers. Over the years the building has been added to, but now parts of the school aren't in use any more. During 1977 the school role reached its peak with about two hundred and seventy children on the role.
